result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip J. Pekala

records.addlTxt:
1:07 PM/ RM 203. Defendant Phillip J. Pekala in court.  Attorney John Zich in court for Phillip J. Pekala.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history. State is ready to proceed with P.H. State calls first witness, Deputy Travis Krueger. Deputy Krueger sworn in under oath and testifies. Atty Zich gives cross examination. State rests. Atty Zich is satisfied. Court finds probable cause and binds over for further proceedings. State requests arraignment for a later date. Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:12 PM/ RM 301. Defendant Phillip J. Pekala in court.  Attorney John Zich in court via zoom for Phillip J. Pekala.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Atty Zich has received a copy of the criminal complaint, preserves jurisdictional objections, waives reading and requests a timely P.H. Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

for Bond Modification 
Routed to Judge's JA

for Bond Modification 
Routed to Judge's JA

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:32 PM Defendant Phillip J. Pekala appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. has contacted PD Office. Court is waiting for notice of retainer. Def. would like to address bond. Court notes requests were filed. Def. continues to ask for counsel and Court finds good cause to go past time limits. Def. questions pro se bond modification. Court responds.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

for Bond Reduction 
Routed to Judge's JA

2:14 PM Defendant Phillip J. Pekala appeared by video, in custody from Langlade County Jail  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom.  CC notes initial appearance last week.  Def. has contacted P.D. and wife notes Atty Laufenberg is representing him. Court has no notice of retainer. Defendant would like to be heard on bond.  Court notes bond modification needs to be in writing and Judge Rhode will need to hear.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.

1:03 PM/Rm. 203. Defendant Phillip J. Pekala appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own or court appointed Atty or represent self. State makes bond recommendations and requests $5,000.00 cash bond with conditions No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Def. makes sentencing remarks. Def. has contacted PD office. Court considers bond factors and orders $4,000.00 cash bond with conditions No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
